reviews.review_msg: great prof. midterms were chill but the final was very challenging. He scaled the final so it was fine.

His lectures went super fast and the slides weren't that helpful. The midterms were pretty straightforward if you do the homework and study a bit. The final was crazy hard though. Be prepared to learn a lot of things on your own because the topics are covered too briefly in lecture.
He's a really great professor, very knowledgeable! The midterms are pretty straightforward and easy but the final was a lot harder than the midterms.
Greatly recommend this prof
Great professor. Fun lectures, always engaging.

Nervous little guy.   Does his part to make sure the students have the material i.e. prints out his notes for the class as well as posts them online (extra writing and all). Style: demonstrate first (if possible) explane later.  Not very helpful with homework, prefers the discovery method rather than spoonfeeding.  Interesting prof to have had.

Good prof, I enjoyed his classes quite. His approach tends to be experiment focused (we did experiments in tutorial and he encouraged us to play with things) which I though was great. He expects you to try and figure things out on your own, but if you can't get it, he offers tons of support. Great prof for anyone interested in learning physics.
We asked him a homework question, he told us "the best way to learn is to discuss it among yourselves" and walked away...good prof, i don't think so!
Terrible Teacher, just there to do research. Uselss
This guy CANNOT teach

A pretty caring guy, but his teaching style isn't the best. He solves questions for the whole lecture and sometimes he doesn't even understand the questions he assigns, and then gets super confused. You should already enjoy physics if you want to succeed in this class. The midterms are decently difficult. The homework might take long though

Levon's kind & funny, but his deliverance with PHYS125 wasn't great. He was confused with some topics, and he sometimes came to lectures ill-prepared. So his lectures weren't so useful. But he'd make time outside of class to help, and his grading was VERY lenient. I'm sure he's a good prof with other courses, but 125 wasn't a strong point for him.

Howard (as he insists we call him) is a wonderful person.  He loves his job and being around his students.  He had more office hours than most of my other courses combined. Wasn't always super clear and would have sometimes revisit topics or would have to figure out on our own.  Do the practice questions before the midterm and exams!!!

This teacher was extremely passionate about his teachings. I loved every second in the course except the late nights of studying. I wish I had him next semester! You will like this course if you have any true interest in physics but will need to do some of the learning yourself. He sometimes has difficulties getting his message through

Such a nice guy! He will insist you call him Howard and uses winky faces frequently in e-mails which he sends out almost daily. He's very interesting and I'm so glad I got him for my first go at theoretical physics honestly do the assignments and the review he gives and you'll easily get at least a B
This man is crazy about his job... Awesome prof... love this man

Best prof u can imagine. If ever get chance, take course with him, u won't regret. Really really nice person, inside & outside of class. Most of questions in exams are from review package he provides, be sure to check that. love him

A really helpful and enthusiastic prof. Although his assignment is challenging and mostly conceptual, he sparkles my interest in physics. As long as u finish the assignment, u could get a B. Easy final.
Trottier is the best! If you have the chance, take a course with this prof! Probably the best science teacher in the school!

I'm thankful I had him in the first year, he gave me faith in University life. He is very helpful and also is very enthusiastic about what he is teaching, and that's what makes his lectures so fun to attend.

Really great professor who clearly cares about the content he teaches. His lectures were engaging, and he taught everything in the course very clearly. The course was challenging in the lecture content, homework, and the exams. The final exam was very challenging, but he is a generous marker, and bumped marks up a lot.
Pretty great prof who seems to enjoy teaching and cares about his students. Tests are fair, and class doesn't take too much work.
Good prof, although he scales the mark too much (half the class got As). Also, his lectures are actually pretty interesting.

My best professor this semester.  Really approachable and funny.  Tries his best to make you understand the topic.  This is a class that really teaches you how to think.  And we get field trips and wild tangents about particle physics.  I would definitely take a class with him again.
great proff. great office hours. good sense of humor. really in to particle physics!

Excellent prof, makes the class interesting.  Of course everyone who attends this class is fixated about physics anyway so we're already biased :D Very helpful, his midterms and final are reasonable if you do the homework.  Keep in mind that this will probably be your hardest first year course, however his curve really boosts your grade.

Very nice person, receptive to comments. Always helpful, but office hours are hit or miss (more hits than misses). Tests are really, really hard but scaling rescues your grade. Notes online and are summary of text. Tests sometimes literally taken straight from homework.
Very fair and good prof.  Funny also!
No Comments
